intro: Rhaponticum hemeralpion, commonly known as the alpine rhapontic, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, adapting to harsh, high-altitude environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a daisy-like appearance, and it blooms during the short growing season of its habitat. Rhaponticum hemeralpion is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
